name: Airedale Terrier
fact: Called the King of Terriers because of its size, this terrier was the very first celebrity dog? President Harding had one named Laddie Boy, a media darling who even had his own hand-carved chair!

name: Bull Terrier
fact: You know him as the Bud Light mascot Spuds Mackenzie.

name: Black Russian Terrier
fact: While terrier is in his name, in his country of origin he's actually known as a Russian shepherd.

name: Boston Terrier
fact: This dog was the first terriers developed in America. In 1970 he was designated the State Dog of Massachusetts.

name: Fox Terrier
fact: The wirehaired version of this dog has won Best in Show at Westminster 15 times, more than any other breed.

name: Irish Terrier
fact: Thought to be developed in Ireland, this is one of the oldest terrier terriers. Though now a great pet and ratter, this dog served as a messenger dog during WWI.

name: Manchester Terrier
fact: This dog, an ancestor of the Doberman, comes in two sizes, Standard and Toy.

name: Scottish Terrier
fact: This dog was a favorite of the Bush family. You might remember George W's Barney, who tried to take a chunk out of a TV reporter.

name: Skye Terrier
fact: Named for an island off the northwest coast of Scotland, this terriers was a favorite of Queen Victoria of England and Queen Alexandra of Denmark.

name: Schnauzer
fact: While 'Terrier' is not in this terriers's name, the mini variety is in the Terrier Group. Two other varieties, Standard and Giant, are classified as Working Dogs.

name: Teddy Roosevelt Terrier
fact: Named after a 20th century U.S. president, this dog is bully!

name: Welsh Terrier
fact: He looks like a mini Airedale, but is much more stubborn! This dog comes from Wales and is thought to be the oldest terriers in the United Kingdom.

name: Yorkshire Terrier
fact: Originally bred as a rat hunter, this companion dog is now a member of the Non-Sporting group.

name: rat terrier
fact: This terrier is an American original and has a rodent in his name. He's also the star of the group known as the Ryderâ€™s Alley Trencher-fed Society, aptly shortened to R.A.T.S., a group of owners who take their terriers rats hunting in New York City alleyways.
